website_summaries.verdict: The Supalite II GTX gave outdoor enthusiasts enough reasons to check it out. Its lightness did not compromise its comfort and waterproofing. Hence, it received positive reviews.Nevertheless, its narrow fit and scuff-prone upper did not impress. All things considered, the Berghaus Supalite II GTX may really be a likable hiking boot—especially for the narrow-footed—with its list of commendable features. It may be wise to use it more often on tamed trails though.
pros: The lightness of the Berghaus Supalite II GTX amazed more than a handful of owners
An expert and several hikers liked the suppleness of the leather upper which conformed to the shape of the foot
The comfortable feel of the Supalite II GTX from Berghaus was lauded by the majority
A good deal of pleased wearers testified that breaking it in was not necessary
The ability of this GTX hiking boot to keep water out was exemplary, according to a number of users
A group of testers recommended it for use in less technical terrain
A gear reviewer declared that it offered the best grip on the ground
cons: A couple of those who bought the shoe commented that the forefoot area of the Berghaus Supalite II GTX was restrictive
The upper was prone to scrapes and abrasions, based on a few consumer reviews
A gear critic mentioned that he experienced heel lift
He attributed it to the awkward positioning of the locking hook near the ankle

customer_reviews.title: Made in China - and it shows
customer_reviews.text: So, bought these Aug 2015 for regular dog walking - nothing too agressive; a bit of road, muddy paths and open fields. The heel is now coming away from the boot. Is this a good deal, bearing in mind the cost of these boots? I know other walkers who have had their traditional style walking boots last up to 10 years. Is it that the stuff we buy is just crap? Is it that the manufacturers can't afford to make stuff last a long time? Whatever, I won't be buying Berghaus again.
customer_reviews.author: Grumpyone

customer_reviews.title: Not the same quality as before!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these boots in August 2018 after my previous pair finally gave up the ghost after 5 years of daily use. They have now split and broken after only 16 months! Very disappointed and fear that when Berghaus bought Brasher they may have lowered standards and the products are not up to scratch! I am trying to return to Amazon with no luck yet. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: my personal opinion
customer_reviews.text: I am so pleased with these walking boots. Although I do a lot of dog walking I have never had leather boots before because I thought they might be too heavy. I wore them the day after receiving them and I have had no bother. They are lightweight and very comfortable. I would recommend them as they were recommended to me. I have to say although I am female I choose to wear mens walking boots as they give me a bit more width.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Buxton (Jo Buxton)

customer_reviews.title: Solid pair of boots, though disappointing grip in icy conditions
customer_reviews.text: This was my first set of hiking boots and I was a little disappointed as I found the grip was not very reliable. Although i am referring to my icy conditions, i found there was not sufficient grip and the boot scratched a little easier than I would have hoped. Overall a solid boot, but as a newbie I might have expected a bit more. I also checked with the manufacturer and this was a genuine product.
customer_reviews.author: Sim Emma John

customer_reviews.title: Crackers
customer_reviews.text: Epic boots. Super comfy. Warm yet breathable. I went from circa 1990s hillwalking boots that served me many years, but the final straw was my feet getting soaked in them as they weren't water proof even though they were leather. These boots were a massive upgrade and oh so very comfy. I imagine if you take good care off these boots and nourish them with cream after each heavy use they will last you many many many years of walking
customer_reviews.author: Alan Paterson

customer_reviews.title: BUY THEM!
customer_reviews.text: Without doubt these are the most comfortable boots I have ever worn. I have endless problems with my feet which seem to ache daily no matter what I wear or what I do. These boots are an absolute dream. The comfort is off the chart. Buttery soft leather tongue, beautiful soft liner with top quality leather outer. I cannot believe how incredibly light they are, the sole is grippy. I have not put the GORTEX fully to the test yet but given the obvious quality I have confidence they will keep my feet dry.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Smith

customer_reviews.title: Berghaus was brasher supalite 11 gtx
customer_reviews.text: These are only just arrived. I was not expecting them to be the same quality as the old brasher boots i also have that are wearing out. Not only are the y looking as good, they look very well made and so i will use and test them and remark again once i have a full review, so far though, i can say that i am impressed with the build quality and fit, and the grip is astounding, as i do rock and hill work walking i know i will feel comfortable in these
customer_reviews.author: Rustylargo

customer_reviews.title: Order a bigger size
customer_reviews.text: Have had to order half a size larger again as the size I normally take is too small. Been out only a couple of times and blistered on the heel but am sure will be ok soon. Boots are very well made, easy to put on and off and are definitely lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Pepper

customer_reviews.title: Why re-brand Brasher boots as Berghous ?
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for a previous pair which have had three years of hard use. The previous pair were 'Brasher' and I can confirm that these Berghaus branded seen exactly the same as the old ones and fit exactly as expected. I have for years only bought Brasher boots and was dismayed when the 'Brasher' boots were discontinued , but really relieved when I found that they had simply be rebranded. I think the company should sell these branded brasher as I , and probably others , decided I would have to search for new boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heel pain after even short walks
customer_reviews.text: I suffer heel pain after using these for even short walks of an hour, and I don’t suffer heel pain in any other of my shoes or boots. I’m going to need to invest in some insoles which clearly shouldn’t be necessary in brand new boots of this size. I wish I had returned them earlier
customer_reviews.author: HonestJohn

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic light boots, go a half size up though!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots as expected. Lightweight and waterproof. These fit as expected for me - but only because I knew to order a half size up. My feet are a wee bit wide (spade feet apparently) and they fit fine in these. I got them for a great price at around £75 but doubt we will see those likes again!
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Brasher boots by Berghaus!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a replacement for my brasher Supalite boots. These were no longer available as Brasher was taken over by Berghaus. But, the boots appear to be the same design as the Brasher originals. Having tried them around the house they seem fine, but I have not used them on a long walk yet. The price on Amazon was 30% cheaper than Berghaus, so I feel that they are a bargain - so far!
customer_reviews.author: P. Avery

customer_reviews.title: Upped by 1/2 size to get the same fit as the ‘old’ Brasher boot
customer_reviews.text: I have had a pair of these boots (previously Brasher) for a number of years, and always liked them, hence this order for the ‘now’ Berghaus boot. They seem much the same except for the fit; they are smaller/narrower than the Brasher’s, so I needed to up 1/2 size to get the same fit. Time will only tell if they wear as well as Brasher’s.
customer_reviews.author: dreemerdog

customer_reviews.title: Nice and light but not as good as the original Brasher
customer_reviews.text: I've had supalite Brasher boots for 6 years or so and they've been great, really nice and light, comfortable and a joy to wear. Berghaus has taken over Brasher so I went for these as a replacement. They are still good but don't fit quite as well (slightly narrower at the front) and the leather feels slightly less supple. Will have to see in the longer term whether I'm still happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Al Day

customer_reviews.title: Price increase
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a pair of Berghaus Men's Supalite II Gore-Tex Walking Boots in my usual size of UK8 (42) but when I tried them on they felt slightly tight so I ordered another pair in size UK8.5 (42.5) intending to return the original pair. The new pair fitted very well. However, the price had increased from £106.42 for size 8 to £124.61 or size 8.5. An increase of over £18 (17%). This seems excessive for the same boot.
customer_reviews.author: Philip and Lynne Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and light boot.
customer_reviews.text: Soft leather lined , easy to lace and adjust, had to order a half size larger than usual for me to get a comfortable wider fitting. Not tested the water-proofing yet but pleased with these boots, comfortable straight out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pascoe

customer_reviews.title: Usual Supalite build and comfort
customer_reviews.text: 3rd pair over 10 years, same build & materiel quality, No break in, walking straight out of the box. Slight difference in internal stitching pattern and boot sole design (Now vibram) Will see how they hold up under use.
customer_reviews.author: Tango

customer_reviews.title: Great boots
customer_reviews.text: Most of my walking group now use this type of boot. Light, comfortable, virtually no need to 'break-in' - at least for modest distances. I switched from the canvas/gortex type. Easy to clean but need to polish to keep them looking good and probably help to maintain waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Sam.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fitting from the start but 6 months later.......
customer_reviews.text: Used to be owned by Brashers I think.But the boots are perfect from the time you put them on.The only let down ....The laces have to be double bowed to ensure they do not open.This seems to be an issue with lots of boot manufacturers.I use mine for work so loose laces can be dangerous. 6 months on and the front rubber piece is starting to peel from the toe.As usual.Had this happen on boots several times.
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: You can't beat a really proven pattern - this is IT!
customer_reviews.text: Husband very pleased with his new boots - just as good as his Brashers (he has had 2 hard worked pairs when they were known as Brashers) - obviously Berghaus keeping on with a good thing! We are happy and the boots are out there already going thro' their paces in a productive garden! Many thanks to all involved from factory to delivery!
customer_reviews.author: mijm

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable lightweight boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots to replace an old Brasher pair that I’ve had for years and which I loved. There have been some changes to the design by Berghaus but even after very little running in these are great. They’re light and very comfortable. Hoping they’ll give me as good service as my Brashers. I mainly walk on lowland trails which are often very muddy and wet - for which these seem ideally suited , although on occasional trips up steeper and rocky trails they seem fine.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever
customer_reviews.text: I use these when walking the dog, 2x3 miles a day , they were and still are very comfortable from day one , so light yet the support is brilliant , soft and waterproof
customer_reviews.author: Stevie Lawson

customer_reviews.title: The Business
customer_reviews.text: These boots live up to their name,as they really do weigh very little.They are comfortable straight from the box too.l have completed several lengthy walks in wet and dry conditions, and they have been waterproof and supportive throughout.
customer_reviews.author: Dunelm 67

customer_reviews.title: What has happened to the Berghaus reputation for quality? Fake or just poorly made
customer_reviews.text: The photos tell you everything about the decline in quality of this brand. These boots were either fakes or very poorly made. They were first worn about 18 months ago and have been used almost daily for for a couple of hours of dog walking on farmland and open countryside. Berghaus used to produce a quality product that lasted several years. No longer, these are absolute rubbish. AVOID!
customer_reviews.author: AndyY2k

customer_reviews.title: Brasher quality to Berghaus
customer_reviews.text: Owned a pair of these when they were called 'Brasher Supalites'. Still going strong after 10 years and many dog walking miles. Hope Berghaus havnt spoiled them, time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: POV16

customer_reviews.title: Are these really 'Brasher's' with a 'Berghaus' label?  Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these under the Brasher name and they were great, straight out of the box, walked miles and never a problem. Got these 'Berghaus' boots and I assume they are the same, therefore it's strange that they are so different. The first time I wore them on a short walk they rubbed just above the ankles, after a few more short walks they seemed okay, so today I went on a 2-3 mile walk, I now have an area on my right heel, the size of a 10p piece, where, after blistering, the skin has been removed.
customer_reviews.author: john norris

customer_reviews.title: Brasher Quality, Cool and Lightweight, Ideal for Warmer Months
customer_reviews.text: Always buy Brasher (Bergaus) boots, comfortable out of the box, consistent sizing, and wide fiiting suits me perfectly. These are leather in and out. Tend to wear these in the summer as they are cooler and lighter. A quality, well made boot.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.text: Brought for dad as a birthday present he’s well happy I’ve got hillmaster 2 boots myself but these might be my next buy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great 3 season boot
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots, I had a pair before and wore the sole out completely - very comfortable and great for 3 season wear.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A Witt

customer_reviews.title: good overall
customer_reviews.text: sturdy, keeps feet dry, feet may sweat, a little too big in size, the leather on the two boots is slightly different
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and Supportive Boots
customer_reviews.text: These were a present for my husband who reports they are very comfortable, flexible yet supportive. Worn for first time climbing hills in Powys with no adverse effects at all. Recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Linda R

customer_reviews.title: First class
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. My husband does many outward bound expeditions & would always wear these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Dodo16

customer_reviews.title: Narrower than Brasher
customer_reviews.text: Had brasher in size 10.5 for years no problem, bought the same berghaus made ones and they're totally different fit, much narrower.
customer_reviews.author: BOB

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit but brilliantly made
customer_reviews.text: lightweight is the word, they look brilliantly made, but am afraid the fit is not wide enough. I have ordered the Hillwalker which claim to be a wider fit, although heavier, I am sorry to have to return these
customer_reviews.author: WWW

customer_reviews.title: They were faulty and very unconfortable!
customer_reviews.text: The boots had a large ridge on the outer right boot - really painful and gave me cramp! I've gone back to my old faithful boots - GriSports (love these and as a mountain runner I need boots that are comfortable, light and robust!). Don't purchase the Berg boots. Purchase GriSports - saves you money and they are a better boot!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great boots for the price! Good fit - bought as a present for my husband and ordered same size as he would take in everyday shoes - perfect fit and also good for a slimmer foot. Heels need to be worn in gradually but softening up nicely. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: MOIRA ANDERSON

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable light boots. Recent purchase so will see how they pan out
customer_reviews.author: Jevvy

customer_reviews.title: Took a while to arrive, but worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I was concerned these may have been fake, berghaus assured me they weren’t. Got like a dream and super comfy, I bought several sizes but the 11s fit like a glove!!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Ramm

customer_reviews.title: Four week of agony
customer_reviews.text: Just returned from four week walking holiday, feet wrecked, when I checked the product after holiday they'd sent 7.5 UK instead of the 8.5 ordered. Now outside return window and product not fit for purpose. I've used this product for over ten years but now very disappointed with service on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: We always buy the nubuck version in these but they always end up leaking so tried these instead, no leaks and the material isn’t stiff like it could look,
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and well made
customer_reviews.text: Had these for a few months now and am very pleased. The waterproofing is very good and they have broken in nicely. The soles were a little stiff to start with but are now very comfy. They are very lightweight for the quality of boot.
customer_reviews.author: Peter r.

customer_reviews.title: Not for me I'm afraid.
customer_reviews.text: I sent them back, not for me these. See my other reviews for the ones I did keep.
customer_reviews.author: gaz.tronomy

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant boots
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable, light, look great and super value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Phil Barker

customer_reviews.title: Berghaus Boots
customer_reviews.text: Excellent service from Amazon ,I normally take a 10 so I ordered a 10 and 10.5 .Decided to keep the 10 but after a few weeks of use they are too big and causing blisters on my heel probably would have got away with a 9.5.
customer_reviews.author: grahamxr

customer_reviews.title: They don't look great to be honest
customer_reviews.text: They don't look great to be honest, my wife has the brasher version and they seem to be worlds apart in term of quality. Time will tell how they last though
customer_reviews.author: Philip

customer_reviews.title: Superlite
customer_reviews.text: Simple good style , on my second pair .worn about six days a week (cept hols) will easily last 12 months with the upper still good
customer_reviews.author: STANSLAD

customer_reviews.title: Developed a defect after 50 miles
customer_reviews.text: Even after walking the boots in the left-hand boot is still cause a blister due to a defect now developed in the boot. Unfortunately now beyond Amazon accepting returns. Expected better from a supposedly quality walking boot supplier.
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Best boots I've worn
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of Brasher and these are the Berghaus replacements. Best boots I've worn. Really comfortable and if they are as durable as the Brashers then they will take me through to my retirement.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Bought for DoE, ideal.
customer_reviews.text: Good boots, good fit, been used for a few hikes still fine.
customer_reviews.author: junglejim

customer_reviews.title: Good quality lightweight boots.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality light weight walking boots with soft leather lining. Very pleased with product.
customer_reviews.author: Anita Christy

customer_reviews.title: Immediate Comfort.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Superlites. The first pair lasted over 10 years and are still perfectly wearable, they just lost their waterproofing. I love this boot. Super comfortable from day 1.
customer_reviews.author: Roisin Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots - rugged but very lightweight. This is my second pair of the same classic design- the first lasted me ten years!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. John Stanley

customer_reviews.title: Great walking boot
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my father who complimented the comfort and quality of these boots. Requiring no time to wear in at all. And improves his stride speed with the angle of the sole - Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: dane roberts

customer_reviews.title: COMFORTABLE
customer_reviews.text: Bought for walking to work. 40 minute walk. VERY comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Could be broader for a size 10.5
customer_reviews.text: Solid and well-made but with hindsight I probably should have gone for a half size larger. Length is perfect - but a little narrow. Hopefully they will expand a little with use.
customer_reviews.author: FreddyFeldwit

customer_reviews.title: these boots are less comfortable. I only use them for about town
customer_reviews.text: I'm used to military spec mountain boots and compared to those, these boots are less comfortable. I only use them for about town, and for that they excel. They are comfortable, and very light. No idea about performance on a hill though.
customer_reviews.author: A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic buy
customer_reviews.text: Comfy boot the tongue can get a bit annoying that's my only gripe about it only worn once walking through wet fields and puddles and my feet stayed try so far very impressed 👍
customer_reviews.author: Rodders1882

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant walking boots!
customer_reviews.text: Had a pair of Brasher before and these are just the same, brilliant, lightweight, comfortable and waterproof. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: janet ellis

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought normal shoe size and fitted fine.Comfortable out of the box and completely waterproof. Well made with a quality Vibram sole. Best boots I have bought for ages.
customer_reviews.author: mr jonathan langford

customer_reviews.title: A little small
customer_reviews.text: Great Boots but a little tight across the front of the foot, but very lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew T

customer_reviews.title: Too tight but replaced quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Had to return original order as size 10.5 was too tight. Was surprised at this a have worn original 10.5 boots with no problem for the last 15 years. Replaced very quickly with size 11 which fit more comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Martyn Bushell

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable from day one
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace my comfy old Brasher Supalite II boots. They were excellent apart from the front of the sole coming unglued. I'm hoping that now these boots are branded Berghaus and have a Vibram sole, the problem won't reoccur. No problems so far and comfortable from day 1.
customer_reviews.author: Wayland

customer_reviews.title: Excellent walking boots
customer_reviews.text: I’ve purchased these boots previously and they are quality light weight waterproof walking boots
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of  light walking boots
customer_reviews.text: Great pair of boots. Fit the same as my old brashers. I would say they have improved somewhat with a much sturdier heel.. They haven’t been of my feet since I got them. Fantastic boots.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel A Stead

customer_reviews.title: Comfy
customer_reviews.text: Had Brasher before, so I knew what I was getting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: These are my second pair and I couldn't find anything wrong with the first pair. Fit like a glove.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable from first time on.
customer_reviews.text: Very light and comfortable. No need to break them in. Have purchased Brasher Conditioning Cream to protect them. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Garth

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. They have been only used for recreational walking but the soles have worn out within 8 months.
customer_reviews.author: T. Greenway

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality and light weight, tried on in shop but no half sizes available until I found these
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Ann Miller

customer_reviews.title: Terrible boots
customer_reviews.text: I'm extremely disappointed as I purchased these in January and only just worn them, and the first time of wearing the sole has started to come detatched
customer_reviews.author: Peter M

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant boots!
customer_reviews.text: So light and so comfy. Will be getting a new pair when needed!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Very light and supremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.text: Second pair that I own now. You can wear them all day straight out of the box. Very light and supremely comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sproson

customer_reviews.title: Shoes are better than socks
customer_reviews.text: Shoes. Shoes are better than socks, especially out there in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Belial

customer_reviews.title: Creeking boots
customer_reviews.text: The boots are very comfortable but the problem I had was every step I took the boots would creek really loud.not what you want on a nice quiet walk so I sent my first pair back received another pair and they did exactly the same
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very light, well made and waterproof. I did repack the inner soles with gel-based ones to complete the comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Mr A Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots
customer_reviews.text: Really nice and comfortable , last pair lasted me Three years so fingers crossed
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: My Favourite Boots
customer_reviews.text: great boots , this is my second pair. Very comfortable for all day wearing
customer_reviews.author: Rougeleo

customer_reviews.title: Unbeatable with new insoles
customer_reviews.text: Comfortable boot that breaks in within 3 days. Insole is rubish. I replaced the insole with aertex orthotics and it made the boots more comfortable than trainers. I used them for a 3 mile run through wet trails covered with melting snow and they performed very well. My new go to boot.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin E Woods

customer_reviews.title: Good boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought to replace worn out version when it was Brasher..so far so good
customer_reviews.author: Lynne Smith

customer_reviews.title: I found these boots slipery on wet rock and ice be carefull.
customer_reviews.text: The boots fitted fine . Have had the boots just over a year and haven't worn them much but each time on wet slope or ice am slipping over.
customer_reviews.author: P Southgate

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and extremely light! (an important factor when you are 70+)

customer_reviews.title: Good boot with basic faults.
customer_reviews.text: The laces are too short to allow for the boor to be fully laced up, the laces also slip undone very easily. Two rather basic faults.
customer_reviews.author: Mr S.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect - looking for a light weight design that was ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect - looking for a light weight design that was similar to my old Brasher boots (who Berghaus took over). Does the job and is incredibly light for a pair of walking boots.
customer_reviews.author: MR N Y DOLPHIN

customer_reviews.title: I ordered these half a size bigger than other boots ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these half a size bigger than other boots and one size bigger than my shoes. The supalite boots were too narrow. I had Brasher boots a few years ago and they fitted perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Mr Norman w martin

customer_reviews.title: Berghaus walking boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots for my husband as he does a lot of walking with our dogs, he assures me they are excellent and would highly recommend them. So comfortable and light unlike many other walking boots. Also the speed in which they came was a bonus. Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Ange

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: It was exactly as specified and is a good purchase
customer_reviews.author: RogerP

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant all weather dog walking
customer_reviews.text: So far so good very pleased and glad too have dry feet
customer_reviews.author: Dcmac

customer_reviews.title: the boots are very comfortable. I made my first ascent and there were ...
customer_reviews.text: As for now, the boots are very comfortable. I made my first ascent and there were no problems at all.
customer_reviews.author: Konstantinos Gofas

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots light comfortable and very waterproof. Soles seem to be wearing more than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Grant

customer_reviews.title: Super Supalite
customer_reviews.text: A great boot. Nice and comfortable with grippy soles, unlike the previous Brasher version. Very light, breathable and rugged. Can't praise them enough.
customer_reviews.author: John Pettey

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good hiking boot. My second pair by this particular brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: durable and great
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased these boots before and was impressed with the price on offer here, light, durable and great value
customer_reviews.author: margieg

customer_reviews.title: Mens Berghaus Supalite ll Gtx walking boots
customer_reviews.text: It is too early to review the boot as they have not been worn. The slight negative is the laces are too short
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boots were returned and replaced with size 9 within a couple of days perfect
customer_reviews.text: Ordered size 8 same size as my other walking boots but too small. Boots were returned and replaced with size 9 within a couple of days perfect fit
customer_reviews.author: robert  plewinski

customer_reviews.title: Quality boots for everyday outdoor use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality boots, very light and comfortable. Well packaged and delivered ahead of expected time. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: EireRocks

customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking shoes but the new production is narrower than the previous ones, so they do not fit
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking pair of cross-country walking shoes with a high front to cope with puddles and wet plants. However, unlike my last pair of size 9 UK / 43 EUR from Braisher / Berghaus, these are too narrow for my wider than average feet. So it seems that Berghaus have taken on the Braisher brand but made the shoes narrower. Will have to return them. I also see that the collar padding is less substantial than on the Berghaus / Braisher Hillwalker II GTX shoes, which are in fact a touch lighter and the pair of those which I have just bought, which look rather scuffed like old stock, are in fact wide enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: rick bon

product_meta.title: Berghaus Supalite Ii Gtx Boot, Men's High Rise Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: Weighing less than a kilo per pair, the Supalite II GTX won't slow you down and won’t compromise on performance, durability or comfort
feature_bullets: Weighing less than a kilo per pair, the Supalite II GTX won't slow you down and won’t compromise on performance, durability or comfort
All-day comfort - the streamlined one-piece leather construction with Gore-Tex technology and memory foam detailing keep you in comfort, however long you wear them
Give your feet a treat - breathable, cushioned OrthoLite foot beds keep you comfy all day long
Engineered flexibility and heel fit are designed to fit your feet with comfortable precision
